text: Aranadan or Eranadan (ISO: ; ; ) is a Dravidian language spoken by several hundred people, predominantly in the Malappuram District of Kerala state, India.Ethnologue report for language code: aaf It is similar to Malayalam and Tamil, and also contains elements of the Kannada language. It is also known as Aranatan or Malappuram Bhasha. ==References== Category:Malayalam language Category:Languages of Kerala
title: Aranadan language
